Potential Roles And Responsibilities

  • Protectors: Frontliners protect crowds from police advancements and projectiles using sturdy shields.
  • Peaceful Protestors: These peacekeepers keep the energy and rhythm of a protest moving by leading chants and helping with crowd communication. Some may record police violence and may take note of police weaponry.
  • Digital Comms: People who monitor police scanners to inform protestors and event organizers about real-time police advancements and strategies.
  • Suppliers: People who bring and distribute necessary supplies amongst crowds. This includes, but are not limited to, water bottles, first-aid kits, protest banners, clothes, and snacks.
  • Medics: People with various medical expertise who treat injured protestors.
